channel.title: Comments on: Heat Or Ice For Gout Relief?

item.title: By: Keith Taylor at GoutPal
item.dc:creator: Keith Taylor at GoutPal
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/3099/heat-or-ice-for-gout-relief/#comment-13">GoutPal1</a>.
Thanks, Geroid.
Heat treatment isn't specific to any joint. Therefore, my short answer is 'Yes'. But, there are many other more important issues to consider. You should only use heat treatment for gout pain in your wrist as a temporary measure. Your permanent solution is to reduce uric acid to safe levels. Then, you will not need heat treatment for your gouty joints, or any other form of pain control.
Please add your thoughts at <a href="http://goutpal.net/forums/topic/review-heat-or-ice-for-gout-relief/" rel="nofollow"> Review Heat Or Ice For Gout Relief</a>.
